Note.Content: MT יָשִׂים עוֹד ESV "to consider further" NIV "examine further" | RSV NRSV "appointed a time" NJPS "set time" GNT CEV "set a time" = "יָשִׂים מוֹעֵד"

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration
= causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place
= causative action by which humans or deities hold (other) humans responsible for an event that has taken place or that is to take place in the future

Glosses.Gloss: to place (responsibility on someone) > to lay upon

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to put children; hence: = causative action by which humans bring forth children
literally: to lay (one's) hand (on someone); hence: = causative action by which deities inflict punishment on nations, ◄ as if striking them with their hand
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
literally: to place (one's) home; hence: = action by which humans settle in a certain place with the purpose of making it their home
literally: to put (one's) name (somewhere); hence: = causative action by which deities link their name to a certain location by declaring it their dwelling-place
= causative action by which deities call objects to existence
literally: to put name and remnant; hence: = causative action by which humans do what is needed to ensure that they (or others) have living descendants to perpetuate their name
literally: to put (one's) hands (on someone); hence: = action by which humans seize other humans in order to take them into custody
literally: to put (someone's) seat (somewhere); hence: = causative action by which humans confer a certain status upon other humans
literally: to put a name (for oneself); hence: = action by which humans make an effort to increase their status by certain actions
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
literally: to put (something) in (someone's) ears; hence: = causative action by which humans speak words in the hearing of other humans
literally: to place before (someone); hence: = causative action by which humans pass on a message to other humans ◄ as if it were an object placed in front of them
literally: to put (someone's) name; hence: = causative action by which humans assign a name to other humans
literally: to put glory; hence: = causative action by which humans express their respect for a deity with words and actions
literally: to put (one's) way; hence: = action by which humans change their mode of behavior
= causative action by which humans or deities give (other) humans a certain task or responsibility

Glosses.Gloss: to place (in a position) > to appoint

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to place (one's) eyes (on someone); hence: = action by which humans look intentionally at a particular view

Glosses.Gloss: to set (one's) eyes (on someone) > to look

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to set (one's) face (in a certain direction); hence: = action by which humans or deities fix their eyes in a certain direction, often with the purpose of going there or taking action against it
literally: to put (one's) hand on (one's) mouth; hence: = action by which humans intentionally refrain from speaking
literally: to put (something) in (someone else's) nose; hence: = causative action by which humans cause deities to smell something
literally: to put in (someone's) mouth; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities give (other) humans the assignment to pass on a specific message to others

Glosses.Gloss: to put in (someone's) mouth > to give (to someone) to speak

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to put in (someone's) hand; hence: = causative action by which deities gave humans the ability to perform a certain event

Glosses.Gloss: to give in (someone's) hand > to give (someone) the power (to do something)

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to put (one's) mind on (someone); hence: = action by which humans determine that someone has authority and that his will is to be respected
literally: to put (one's) heart on (something); hence: = to process information in one's mind, often with the intention to act upon it later
literally: to put in/to/on (one's) heart; hence: = to process information in one's mind, often with the intention to act upon it later
literally: to set a time; hence: = action by which humans or deities determine a certain moment in the future for an event to take place
literally: to put a place; hence: = action by which a deity takes a decision regarding the location where a certain activity will take place
literally: to set (someone) before (oneself); hence: = action by which humans give thought to a deity and try to please him

Glosses.Gloss: to place before (oneself) > to mindful of

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to put (one's) life in (one's) hands; hence: = action by which humans decide to perform an event at the risk of their lives
literally: to set (one's) face (to do something); hence: = action by which humans exercise their minds to determine what will happen or what they will do
literally: to put before (one's) face; hence: = action by which humans decide that something is of significant importance for them and needs to be dealt with
literally: to put understanding; hence: = causative action by which humans make an effort to help other humans achieve a better understanding of certain information

literally: to place (one's) eyes (on someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities pay special attention to (other) humans, ◄ as if they were keeping their eyes on them at all times; ≈ this can be understood both in a positive and a negative sense
NO DATA YET
